pifire.description: This is the default PiFire module supporting the Raspberry Pi Zero W (1/2).  Choose this module if PiFire is running on a Raspberry Pi.

standalone.description: Select if your are using PiFire alongside the OEM Controller.

triggerlevel.description: Select the trigger level for the relays on the platform.

four_probes.description: Select if your PCB supports 3 or 4 probe inputs

pifire_pwm.description: This is the PWM PiFire module supporting the Raspberry Pi Zero W (1/2).  Choose this module if PiFire is running on a Raspberry Pi and your PCB supports a 12v DC PWM Fan.

standalone.description: Select if your are using PiFire alongside the OEM Controller

triggerlevel.description: Select the trigger level for the relays on the platform.

dc_fan.description: Select if your platform supports a DC PWM fan or uses a regular AC Fan.

four_probes.description: Select if your PCB supports 3 or 4 probe inputs

prototype.description: This module is used for testing and debug purposes only.  Only select this module if you know what you are doing.

standalone.description: Select if your are using PiFire alongside the OEM Controller

triggerlevel.description: Select the trigger level for the relays on the platform.

dc_fan.description: Select if your platform supports a DC PWM fan or uses a regular AC Fan.

four_probes.description: Select if your PCB supports 3 or 4 probe inputs

ads1115.description: This is the default PiFire module supporting the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC.  Most configurations will use this module for probe input.  If you experience trouble with this module, try the Adafruit modules.  There has been rumors of sellers shipping ADS1015 12-Bit ADC's instead of the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC's.  If you got one of these, you can try the 1015 library instead.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

ads1015_adafruit.description: This module supports the ADS1015 12-Bit ADC based on Adafruit's Circuit Python implementation/module.  This version can also be used with the ADS1115, as it is backward compatible.  Some fidelity may be lost due to the fact that the ADC has less bits to measure with, however in testing it seems to be reasonably good.  Use this if you are having issues with the default ADS1115 module.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

ads1115_adafruit.description: This is an alternative module supporting the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC based on Adafruit's Circuit Python implementation/module.  This version is still actively updated and may support a wider range of hardward.  Use this if you are having issues with the default ADS1115 module.  There has been rumors of sellers shipping ADS1015 12-Bit ADC's instead of the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC's.  If you got one of these, you can try the ADS1015 Adafruit library instead.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (this can be modified in settings later)

prototype.description: This is the test module for probe input.  It should only be used for testing & debug.

units.description: Select the temperature units to use for PiFire globally.  (This can be modified in settings later)

ili9341e.friendly_name: ILI9341 TFT with Rotary Encoder Input (standard)
ili9341e.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.
ili9341e.notes: Pinout: Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24).  Encoder - CLK = GPIO16, DT = GPIO20, SW = GPIO21

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

ili9341em.friendly_name: ILI9341 TFT with Rotary Encoder Input (max31865 version)
ili9341em.description: NOTE: This version should be used if also using the max31865, due to SPI conflicts with the standard implementation.  The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.
ili9341em.notes: Pinout: Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO12, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO16, RST = GPIO20, CS = CE0(Pin 24). Encoder - CLK = GPIO25, DT = GPIO24, SW = GPIO23

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

ili9341.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch.
ili9341.notes: Pinout: MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24)

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

ili9341b.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports a three button input.
ili9341b.notes: Pinout:  Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24). Buttons - UP = GPIO16, DOWN = GPIO20, ENTER = GPIO21

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

st7789_240x320b.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This version of the module supports a three button input.
st7789_240x320b.notes: Pinout:  Display - DIN = MOSI(Pin19), CLK=SCLK(Pin23), CS=CE0(Pin24), DC=GPIO24, RST=GPIO25, BL=GPIO05. Buttons - UP = GPIO16, DOWN = GPIO20, ENTER = GPIO21

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

st7789_240x320e.friendly_name: ST7789 IPS Display 240x320px w/ Rotary Encoder Input
st7789_240x320e.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341). This version supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.
st7789_240x320e.notes: Pinout:  Display - DIN = MOSI(Pin19), CLK=SCLK(Pin23), CS=CE0(Pin24), DC=GPIO24, RST=GPIO25, BL=GPIO05. Encoder - CLK = GPIO16, DT = GPIO20, SW = GPIO21

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

st7789_240x320.description: The ST7789 is a 2inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x320px and is an affordable spi display with color. This module supports the 240x320 version and provides the advanced color interface (similar to the ILI9341).
st7789_240x320.notes: Pinout:  DIN = MOSI(Pin19), CLK=SCLK(Pin23), CS=CE0(Pin24), DC=GPIO24, RST=GPIO25, BL=GPIO05

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

none.description: This is for systems without a display.  This module should be selected if no display is present.

prototype.description: This is the test module for display.  This should be used for development & debug only.

pygame_64x128.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

pygame_240x320.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

pygame_240x320b.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

pygame_480x800.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

pygame_480x800b.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

pygame_480x800m.description: This is the test module for display using Pygame.  This should be used for development & debug only.

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

ssd1306.description: These displays are small, only about 1" diagonal, but very readable due to the high contrast of an OLED display. This display is made of 128x64 individual white OLED pixels, each one is turned on or off by the controller chip.

ssd1306b.description: These displays are small, only about 1" diagonal, but very readable due to the high contrast of an OLED display. This display is made of 128x64 individual white OLED pixels, each one is turned on or off by the controller chip.

buttonslevel.description: Select how your button hardware is configured. (HIGH - Pullups, LOW - Pulldowns)

st7789p.description: The ST7789 is a 1.3inch LCD IPS Screen with a resolution of 240x240px and is an affordable SPI display.  This one can be complicated to find the right compatible display, so your mileage may vary.  This module supports the 240x240 version and provides a simple color interface (similar to the SSD1306 OLED).
st7789p.notes: Pinout:  DIN = MOSI(Pin19), CLK=SCLK(Pin23), CS=CE0(Pin24), DC=GPIO24, RST=GPIO25, BL=GPIO05

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

hcsr04.description: This economical sensor provides 2cm to 400cm of non-contact measurement functionality with a ranging accuracy that can reach up to 3mm.

vl53l0x.friendly_name: VL53L0X Time of Flight Distance Sensor
vl53l0x.description: The VL53L0X is a new generation Time-of-Flight (ToF) laser-ranging module and is the hopper sensor of choice for the PiFire project.

prototype.description: This module should be chosen if there is no distance sensor hardware installed, or for testing & debug.
